definition: abbr. for 維吾爾族|维吾尔族, Uighur (Uyghur) ethnic group of Xinjiang
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
race/nationality/ethnicity/clan/by extension, social group (e.g. office workers 上班族)

sentences.english: From the 1500s on, the Ewe were driven from the Niger River delta westwards.
sentences.chinese: 自1500年開始，伊維族便被迫由尼日河往西遷移。

sentences.english: Minority groups such as the Uyghurs complain that they are subjected to discrimination by the majority Han.
sentences.chinese: 但是維族人還是抱怨被漢族人歧視了。

sentences.english: Hans are China's ethnic majority, while a large population of ethnic Uighurs (pronounced WEE'-gurs) lives in Xinjiang.
sentences.chinese: 漢族是中國的主體民族，而新疆居住着大量的維族。

sentences.english: Exile groups have condemned the policy as an attempt to assimilate Uighurs into Han culture.
sentences.chinese: 流亡團體指責此政策企圖同化維族。

sentences.english: Xinjiang is home to many Uyghurs.
sentences.chinese: 新疆是很多維族人的故鄉。

sentences.english: Cambodia deports Uygurs back to China.
sentences.chinese: 柬埔寨將維族騷亂分子驅逐回中國。

sentences.english: Nine Uighurs have been sentenced to death over the fatal riots.
sentences.chinese: 已有九名維族人在血腥騷亂後被判處死刑。

definition: Uighur ethnic group of Xinjiang
pervert (esp. one who gropes women in public)
recidivist/habitual criminal
lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
Qaramay shehiri (Karamay city) or Kèlāmǎyī prefecture-level city in Xinjiang
to boast
lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
Burmese (language of Myanmar)
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
genre of song-and-dance duet popular in northeast China
(not) a single person/(no) one
mama-san, middle-aged woman who runs a brothel, bar etc (loanword from Japanese)/madam
betel nut beauty: a skimpily-dressed, attractive girl who sells betel nut from a glass-walled roadside booth (Tw)
canon/religious rules
wedding night
